monogr.title: Brittain's Ida. Written by that renowned poët, Edmond Spencer
monogr.author: Fletcher, Phineas

div.head: TO THE RIGHT Noble Lady MARY, Daughter to the most Illustrious Prince GEORGE, Duke of Buckingham.
div.p:
I haue presumed to present this little Poëm to your Honourable hand, encouraged onely by the worth of the Famous Author (for I am certainely assured by the ablest, and most knowing men, that it must be a Worke of Spencers, of whom it were pitty that any thing
should bee lost) and doubting not but your Lady-ship will graciously accept, though from a meane hand, this humble present, since the man that offers it, is a true Honourer and Obseruer of your Selfe, and your Princely Family, and shall euer remaine

closer.signed: The humblest of your deuoted Seruants. Thomas Walkley.
